#summary R_card(| F |_{x1, ..., xn})
R_card(| F |_{x,,1,,, ..., x,,n,,}_)
<pre>
inputs: F a first-order formula on equalities,
        i.e. F is a boolean combination of equalities and disequalities of variables and constants. 
          F may have quantifiers.
return: a basic expression representing |F|.
</pre>
`| F <- `[RewriterTopSimplify R_top_simplify]`(F) // this is the only function that does not assume its input is top-simplified`<br>
`|`<br>
`| if n = 0`<br>
`|.... return `[RewriterSimplify R_simplify]`(if F then 1 else 0)`<br>
`|`<br>
`| if n > 0`<br>
`|.... if `[FunctionNegationHasLessNumberOfDisjuncts negationHasLessNumberOfDisjuncts]`(F):`<br>
`|........ return `[RewriterSimplify R_simplify]`(||X|| - `[RewriterCardWithQuantification R_card]`( | not F |`,,X,,,` "none" ))`<br>
`|.... else`<br>
`|........ return `[RewriterCardWithQuantification R_card]`( | F |`,,X,,`, "none")`
